New Records: David Warner is player of the match for his 162
David Warner is player of the match for his 162
Key Match Events: Warner (163) and Marsh (121) put on a monster 259-run stand
Australia defend their 367-9, bowling out Pakistan for 305
WICKET! Shakeel c Stoinis b Cummins 30 from 31 (Pakistan 232-4)
WICKET! Babar c Cummins b Zampa 18 off 14 (Pakistan 175-3)
WICKET! Imam c Starc b Stoinis 70 off 71 (Pakistan 154-2)
WICKET! Shafique c Maxwell b Stoinis 64 off 61 (Pakistan 134-1)
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan were in the hunt deep into the chase. But losing their last five wickets for 33, well, that’s the story in a nutshell. Everything must go right to chase 368.
Australia move from 10th to 4th. That’s a pretty good few days, wins against Sri Lanka and Pakistan getting their World Cup campaign on track at last.
The game-within-a-game is Australia being at least three overs behind their required over rate, which means they need this to be completely iced by over 47 – something like that.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan were in the hunt deep into the chase. But losing their last five wickets for 33, well, that’s the story in a nutshell. Everything must go right to chase 368.
Dave Warner joins Simon Doull. To begin, says his groin niggle, which prevented him from fielding, isn’t that serious – some cramping.
Adam Zampa celebrates after taking the wicket. Photograph: Sajjad Hussain/AFP/Getty Images
Miscellaneous Highlights: The required run rate is 8.5. Manageable.
The Cricket Ground DJ plays Working Class Man. They’re away… at last.
The 100-run stand is also up, the first for Pakistan in World Cups since 2015, the TV tells me.
Shaheen Shah Afridi has taken 25 wickets from just 9 games in World Cups.
Others: Warner (163) and Marsh (121) put on a monster 259-run stand
Australia celebrate winning the match. Photograph: Robert Cianflone/Getty Images
